attributes.comment:
Dear Sirs,

With regard to the increase in fees for:
Adoption-Related Petitions Affected by the Proposed Increase
I-600/600A Petition to Classify Orphan as an Immediate Relative from $545 to $670
N-565 Application for Replacement of Certificate of Citizenship (used for name
changes) from $220 to $380
N-600 Application for Certificate of Citizenship from $255 to $460
Biometric Services (fingerprints) from $70 to $80

I am curious what added benefit I would be deriving from these increases? Will
the length of time these documents are valid be increased? Would there be some
way to state that those in process could be "grandfathered in" so that increases
or redoing of these doucments would not need to be done if the family is in
process of adoptiing a child and the documents expire?
We have been told not to comment about the cost, but I have to comment about
the cost. Each international adoption is expensive- if I was able to give birth to a
child, my insurance would cover the cost of that child, but I am not able to have a
biological child and I have choosen to form my family through adoption. As my
process has moved throught he courts in Guatemala, I am forced to renew
documents for the US that are expiring- like my finger prints, soon my I-171H.
These are expenses that continue to rise, they increase the cost of my adoption
beyond what I was told to plan for. I can understand an increase in the fees, if it
was a one time thing- that the documents I paid for at the beginning of this
adoption would carry through to the end no matter how long it takes. The fact that
a foriegn court is moving slower should not be the reason I have to redo these
documents and pay for them again at a higher fee. Can you not increase the time
these
documents are good for such that families are not required to redo these
doucments in process? Can you not consider making the fee increases only for
those now starting the process and requesting these documents?

As I look at these documents, I do not see the increase in overhead to provide
them- computers are doing more and more of the work (background searches,
electronic finger prints, etc). These process are more efficient, so what is driving
these increases?

Thank you for your time and the opportuinity to comment.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by D. A. Cole
